sentence.Network_en: " Perchance,'said Mr. Dimmesdale, " he earnestly desired it, but could not. "
sentence.Network_cn: “ 也可能,”丁梅斯代尔先生说, “ 他诚心诚意地切望如此, 但他办不到. ”

sentence.Network_en: The soil where this dark miner was working had perchance shown indications that encouraged him.
sentence.Network_cn: 那是因为这个阴沉的矿工所挖掘的土地中刚好显露了鼓励他的一些迹象.

sentence.Network_en: He would, perchance , have pitied this sick man , of the law's making.
sentence.Network_cn: 他也许会替那个被法律伤害了的人叫屈.

list.abs: and of everything that he met he made enquiry if perchance they had seen his mother .并且一切他遇见他的那做了询问，如果他们偶然地看见了他的母亲。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French par cheance 'by chance'

means.word_mean: 1. through chance, "To sleep, perchance to dream.."

sentences.sentence: "we may possibly run into them at the concert"
"it may peradventure be thought that there never was such a time"
